department.dept_long_name: Committee on the Study of Religion

course.title: Introduction to Islamic Mysticism: The Sufi Tradition
course.description: Introductory survey of Sufism, focusing on its fundamental concepts, ritual practices, institutions, and its impact on literary and sociopolitical life in different Muslim societies.
course.prerequisites: An introductory course in Islam or equivalent helpful but not essential.
course.notes: This course, when taken for a letter grade, meets the General Education requirement for Culture and Belief. This course fulfills the requirement that one of the eight General Education courses also engage substantially with Study of the Past. Offered jointly with the Divinity School as 3620.
